flawed_nl_solution:
In the second third of the trip, Lydia is going to use 60 liters of fuel / 3 = <<60/3=20>>20 liters of fuel.
In the final third of the trip, she needs half of this amount so she is going to be using 20 liters / 2 = <<20/2=10>>10 liters of fuel.
So in the first third, Lydia used the remaining amount of fuel which is 60 total liters of fuel - 20 liters of fuel in the second third - 10 liters of fuel in the final third = <<60-20-10=35>>35 liters of fuel.
#### 35

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 30, not 35. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
